document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Social Studies

5BC236164FA746C18CE42C0CB23CAC6B.description: evaluate the impact of changes in technology on personal growth and development

7BCEAE7A1D984BD4B85BD482CBF0B9BF.description: analyze examples of attitudes, beliefs, and behaviors related to changes in available technology

CD6FE2523B1743B38A10A0795773E74D.description: The student understands the relationship of changes in technology to personal growth and development

0E0972B63C4943F7B0B17893AFB69E87.description: monitor and evaluate self-directed inquiry or projects for timelines, accuracy, and goal attainment

FB4A6E3D80EF4F23A08488A75542776E.description: illustrate the relationship and sequence between intermediate goals and terminal goals

789A2B837B2D427996614F4B6E463473.description: The student develops long-term and short-term goal-setting skills for individual and community problem solving

B838F6A9A45A4BF4AFF90ED1E5662F06.description: participate in conflict resolution using persuasion, compromise, debate, and negotiation.

8EEDAB281F08437A95D8D83262E618B8.description: use a decision-making process to identify a situation that requires a decision, gather information, identify options, predict consequences, and take action to implement a decision;

3ED55D2CD6904B37969B7C5BE33058CA.description: use a problem-solving process to identify a problem, gather information, list and consider options, consider advantages and disadvantages, choose and implement a solution, and evaluate the effectiveness of the solution;

8F745EDD75904661B1F000367A7227C3.description: The student uses problem-solving and decision-making skills, working independently and with others, in a variety of settings

27748AB1F70749318D70DC5BC7172CE5.description: create written, oral, and visual presentations of social studies information

1CD3348D5C4D483F87A52B56D2E160EA.description: transfer information from one medium to another, including written to visual and written or visual to statistical, using computer software as appropriate

4DCDABC218F34385997885FD473F6F4E.description: use standard grammar, spelling, sentence structure, and punctuation

BF73FC9807A14DE8B898D8FB38F7E5A6.description: The student communicates in written, oral, and visual forms

35AEFDF822534FD699D45A32530E05E2.description: analyze information by sequencing, categorizing, identifying cause-and-effect relationships, comparing, contrasting, finding the main idea, summarizing, making generalizations and predictions, and drawing inferences and conclusions

1D961468AA0947638F953B96E8F3492F.description: apply evaluation rules to quantitative information

655A9A4BAFA64A6BB425F244BF474983.description: draw and evaluate conclusions from qualitative information

8F48B44F39FC4CE1868DCBAA354569D5.description: create a product on a contemporary psychology-related issue or topic using critical methods of inquiry

E49C03EFABCA470F876F9A994416716B.description: The student applies critical-thinking skills to organize and use information acquired from a variety of valid sources, including electronic technology

2E3DD00B003A4DBF928BF799DA4AB51A.description: identify sources of attitude formation and assess methods used to influence attitudes

86FD6ED53AAF420D99322C3C9696DE2C.description: describe the effects of the presence of others on individual behavior

7415D1291B484C99AA4235A4DD5EBC1A.description: describe circumstances in which conformity and obedience are likely to occur

7EF34488BA6D4ED8BF349915CB08EF84.description: explore the nature and effects of bias and discrimination

B1748A69A9B54263A029846194201ED2.description: describe how attributions affect explanations of behavior

C0E897317BCC4979A6CE108A086BE134.description: The student will understand the influence of society and culture on behavior and cognition

5142ED12972F40D5BF0EBE9902E889D8.description: evaluate the effectiveness of past and present methods of therapy.

AA1E7590F08B4A4BA1E584C92329B72E.description: discuss major categories of abnormal behaviors and identify their respective characteristics as classified in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM);

9089CD9F458D4C02BE4719C15C900A39.description: recognize the biological, social, and cognitive origins of abnormal behavior;

FE68602B5DAA4E9CB7FAEE8BC187A2D8.description: analyze the challenges inherent in defining abnormal behavior and acknowledge the sociocultural stigma of labeling behavior as abnormal;

9895188C1A1446EDA831D7B496F8E166.description: evaluate cognitive and behavioral strategies for dealing with stress;

945BBEF24D404D5288B5FE2BEA3B0E67.description: explain stress and the individual's physiological, behavioral, and psychological responses to stressors;

D044157423BB4BC187337BF097C27031.description: The student understands the multifaceted aspects of mental health

3FA821B2E42A4F0099DE849F1F0366DF.description: understand the states and levels of consciousness.

7D9AF434C945451B94F4E8869EF39F51.description: evaluate the limitations and capabilities of the information processing model;

E343E364B93B4D63A013EE5F3FDDA93E.description: discuss theories of language acquisition and development;

D2F58666598C4E1CB3CCBBCACA306DB2.description: explore the structural features of language;

D3032424EAE241C99B0A690511E011D6.description: identify strategies and obstacles associated with problem solving and decision making;

4A8613CCADAF475580DF25CCBB2B3DBE.description: define and identify the basic elements of thought;

909B0C9F2B874FCE8096C3AFF2951DCA.description: The student understands basic elements of cognition

AEC4B77EFF9A40FA8C22F6028B108029.description: compare and evaluate various theories of personality, including psychodynamic, trait, humanistic, and sociocultural

5ED5D975DD064CFF8B152C28B0375B17.description: The student understands the development and assessment of personality

F38D5E8798F6445C927B026457451E51.description: differentiate among aptitude, achievement, and Intelligence Quotient (IQ) tests

0BE6000FC4E74812B0AC63868C9DEF72.description: describe statistical concepts used in testing

D32B0F76E0634A199F74A0792ECEF5B5.description: The student understands the basic principles of tests and measurements

75B8DB44C689419AB4E9509AEE24335F.description: The student understands the nature of intelligence. The student is expected to differentiate the various types of intelligence

116973D196654399913A25F22DD40453.description: explore the interaction of biological and cultural factors in emotion and motivation

00C909E14FE74BBBA55E82AE4ACA94C4.description: compare predominant theories of motivation and emotion

567956A1740E468A84748E4B3BE12344.description: The student understands the principles of motivation and emotion

43FE364501224FBAAFEE17161B189493.description: describe the processes of learning using typical classroom situations

A3E56D8C52DA4D718EF1E89330A7B3FF.description: demonstrate an understanding of the principles of operant and classical conditioning and of social learning

5FE91251B5EB4D79B78A31F2E90A4586.description: The student understands behavioral and social learning theories

2E50A1C6C23B411B8623053B381FFDA8.description: evaluate the presented theories of human development and specify the strengths and weaknesses of each

508E50AA4C9A463BA16C2C0D18C543C9.description: evaluate the predicted outcomes of given courses of actions in particular situations based on an understanding of the development of morality

59A6094429E441568EEA8F6B69373749.description: describe Erik Erikson's stages of psychosocial development

31DB523747CB426C8A37F39A003BC208.description: explain factors involved in cognitive development according to Jean Piaget

3302DFAA0821421289BA7A537AF4F281.description: discuss the role of the caregiver on individual development

F01101B96FA44700B98539765862D80E.description: trace the influence of physical development on the individual

303F40F7B4E745829F9B331746004EE8.description: critique the various perspectives presented in the nature versus nurture debate

435EC145BF0F46EE859558577D254CF5.description: The student understands that development is a life-long process

432E2651F3084E00B5820DD7A70BEC76.description: understand the interaction of the individual and the environment in determining sensation and perception

26D8A157DF424C4B9DAFE9D8C6557FC8.description: explain the capabilities and limitations of sensory systems and individual perceptions

8001D3A8569948EBB9974C34DE823245.description: The student understands how sensations and perceptions influence cognition and behavior

1A3B747E842C4AF9B947422F391E24F9.description: explain the effects of the endocrine and nervous systems on development and behavior

69F65317484F40C08FB1C70E16815519.description: describe the anatomy of the central and peripheral nervous systems and the endocrine system

586BE19E1F2C405EAED526DE6BDF1F4B.description: The student understands the relationship between biology and behavior

71ABE0F1AA6E4790BD2986224948F773.description: define and interpret measures of central tendency (mean, median, and mode) and dispersion (range and standard deviation)

9AE98E7338F145E9820FE2B0DD76949A.description: apply the standards of the American Psychological Association (APA) for ethical decision making regarding the collection, storage, and use of psychological data

9259903FA3784F85B2194D26BB20A7FB.description: identify and describe the basic methods of social scientific reasoning

25C2DBB20D9248B2837B38AE2800B088.description: define and differentiate the concepts of theory and principle

E671D5C9019C45F0A4768E96AD2D53BC.description: The student differentiates the processes of theory development and validation

63221B1254024D9F85CFDF250F8E0574.description: explore subfields and career opportunities available in the science of psychology

FA0171F5FE6A4498BBC04E406DCE2426.description: trace the historical development of the contemporary perspectives in psychology, including biological, behavioral, cognitive, sociocultural, humanistic, and psychodynamic

2D22F9009CC2421F90B3526D5C41C223.description: identify characteristics that differentiate the field of psychology from other related social sciences

6406024A720C459F8F3B50C4217A5CAD.description: The student understands the development of the field of psychology
